page.title: 09Tourism in Bridport
page.content: Bridport has long enjoyed popularity as a holiday centre with various types of accomodation. Throughout the summer cars towing caravans crowd the roads approaching the West Bay International Holiday Centre built in 1984 at a cost of Â£250,000. This one_time municipal camping ground now holds 280 static caravans and has room for 350 touring vehicles. The centre features an Entertainment Hall, children's fun room, two large bars, a laundry, supermarket and many showers units with toilet and washing facilities. Although attempts have been made to over_commercialise West Bay, the resort has managed to retain its character as a small, quiet fishing port.
